content: ribbed panta~tapered version this version of the ribbed panta is geared toward those with shorter hair it tapers to a narrower band in the back allowing shorter hair to lay flat original version was worked even all the way around the second pic done in velvet grapes colorway were worked in the wider tapered version described below size i hook approx 50 yard malabrigo worsted merino shown in damask rose colorway top and velvet grapes bottom gauge 12 stitches= 4 in pattern finished size 17 75 inches around unstretched chain=chain stitch single_crochet=single_crochet blo= work in back loop only sl= slip_stitch chain 41 loosely foundation row single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet all chains to end turn 40 stitches row 1 ch1 working in blo back loop only work 2 single_crochet in first single_crochet single_crochet till one single_crochet is left work 2 scs in this stitch turn increase 2 repeat row 1 twice more do not turn after last repeat 46 stitches chain 9 loosely being careful not to twist stitches join chained stitches to opposite end with a sl slip_stitch to first single_crochet turn you will now be working in the round turning after each row to maintain the ribbed effect row 1 ch1 single_crochet in each of the 9 chains just created single_crochet blo next 46 stitches to complete row join with sl to first single_crochet in row turn row 2 ch1 single_crochet around join with sl to first single_crochet turn 55 stitches row 3 repeat row 2 to make the top portion wider repeat row 2-3 one more time or till desired width is reached keeping in mind that panta will be wider still once the following decrease rounds are completed and the band will also be wider upper photos shown above were done by working one extra set of repeats when making the wider version be sure to work both row of repeat so that ribbing is maintained end working in the round and work back and forth from here out row 4 ch1 decrease blo single_crochet blo next 42 stitches decrease blo turn 44 scs row 5 ch1 decrease blo single_crochet blo next 40 stitches decrease blo turn 42 scs row 6 ch1 decrease blo single_crochet blo next 38 stitches decrease blo turn 40 stitches row7 ch1 single_crochet blo across 40 stitches finish off and weave in ends i found it helpful to work the ends through edges where the increases and decreases took place to give them a more finished look block as needed
